definition: to show one's face/to make one's good name/to become successful and well known/to shine
to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
surname Lu
face/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: One morning, very early, before the sun was up.
sentences.chinese: 某天清晨，太阳还没露脸。
我这次给我们两个露露脸。

sentences.english: The song split bar to increase the role of bar, he will have to let people showing up.
sentences.chinese: 把歌分拆吧，增加角色吧，总得让人家露露脸。

sentences.english: The sun won't be seen again for many years.
sentences.chinese: 庄稼毁了，太阳有多年都没有露脸了。

sentences.english: Therefore, a in a media appearances in evidence chance, he never pass.
sentences.chinese: 因此，大凡有在媒体露脸留痕的机会，他都绝不放过。

sentences.english: This gives a web site web presence.
sentences.chinese: 这给了一个网站露脸的机会。

definition: to show one's face/to appear (in public)
to appear on camera/to play a role in a film
a person's face as seen from the front
dew point/(coll.) (of a woman) to expose one of the three areas (nipples and genitals)
a favorite of sb in power/a celebrity/American Indian
to censor an image/to pixelate
photogenic/to appear on film or in the media
to scoop the best camera shots/to grab the limelight
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)

to strike a pose (Chinese opera)/(fig.) to make a public appearance/to come out in public (revealing one's true personality, opinions etc)/(of a product) to appear on the market or at a trade show etc
to cheer on (originally esp. as paid stooge)/to root for sb/to sing sb's praises/to flatter
to expose (photography)/(fig.) to expose (a scandal)/(advertising) exposure/Taiwan pr. [pu4 guang1]
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh
